text: (upbeat music)

- World Kinect's been
around for almost 40 years.
We provide energy, logistics,
and finance solutions in 200 countries
and territories globally.

World Kinect grew up mainly
through acquisitions.

What that provided us with was
a lot of duplicity in people,
process and technology.
We had aging architecture,

enormous amount of
security vulnerabilities
scattered throughout that.
What we were experiencing
was a high amount of critical incidents,
so a very low resiliency.

And for a global organization
that runs 24 by seven,
that resiliency is highly important.

- We also had a challenge
around just the scale of work
that we needed to do.
There was a few challenges that we faced

when trying to migrate our
Oracle e-business suite to AWS,
and the first one was just downtime.
So we looked to AWS Professional Services
to shortcut our learning process.

So they helped us with
operational excellence.
They also helped build confidence

that this platform was
going to perform adequately,

based on what we, how we
configured the environment
in an on-prem situation as well.

- We just didn't need a
platform or a solution.
We needed a partner.

And the 24/7 support that we
have (indistinct) support,
our engineers love that.

You can easily get on
a phone or on a chat,
and it doesn't matter what the problem is.

We at least get guidance
from the, like the SMEs
at the AWS enterprise support.

- We saw about a 20% improvement
in some key operations
inside our Oracle e-business suite.
- Our folks did not have the knowledge
or the skills to leverage AWS.

So we leverage AWS training
and certification program
to get our workforce trained
on all the AWS foundational skills.

We were able to get 85% of
our IT workforce certified
as part of this program.
It got us really great outcomes

in terms of people development,
people progression.

- Fast forward four to five
years to where we are now,
we've closed down our 22 data centers,
was just resulted in not only
a much more secure organization,

but our incidents have come
down roughly about 30 to 40%.
Our meantime to restore is lowered
from 24 hours per incident to under two.
- Now that we are in a position

that we have closed down
all of our data centers
and we are running our operations on AWS,
this is where we truly get to innovate.
